穿.definition: to wear; to put on; to dress; to bore through; to pierce; to perforate; to penetrate; to pass through; to thread

穿一條褲子.definition: (of male friends) to have been through thick and thin together; to be like family; to share the same view of things

穿刺.definition: (medicine) to puncture; to do a needle biopsy

穿回.definition: to put on (clothes); to put (clothes) back on

穿孔.definition: to punch a hole; to perforate; (medicine) perforation

穿小鞋.definition: lit. to make sb wear tight shoes (idiom); to make life difficult for sb

穿幫.definition: (TV or movie) blooper; continuity error; (theater) to flub one's lines; unintended exposure of a body part; to be exposed (of a scheme or trick); to reveal sth one intended to conceal through a slip of the tongue; to blow one's cover

穿戴.definition: to dress; to be dressed; clothing; apparel

穿插.definition: to insert; to take turns, alternate; to interweave; to interlace; subplot; interlude; episode; (military) to thrust deep into the enemy forces

穿搭.definition: (Tw) to mix and match; outfit coordination

穿梭.definition: to travel back and forth; to shuttle

穿破.definition: to wear out (clothes); to pierce (a membrane etc)

穿著講究.definition: smart clothes; particular about one's dress

穿行.definition: to go through; to pass through; to thread one's way through

穿衣.definition: to put on clothes; to get dressed

穿越.definition: to pass through; to traverse; to cross

穿金戴銀.definition: richly bedecked; dripping with gold and silver (idiom)

穿針引線.definition: lit. to thread a needle (idiom); fig. to act as a go-between

穿鑿.definition: to bore a hole; to give a forced interpretation

穿鑿附會.definition: (idiom) to make far-fetched claims; to offer outlandish explanations
